intro: Mertensia laevissima, commonly known as bluebells, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. Its root system consists of fibrous roots that help anchor the plant and absorb nutrients from the soil. Mertensia laevissima thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
